intro: Cleome arborea, commonly known as the tree cleome, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height, featuring woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow or pink flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its botanical characteristics include opposite leaf arrangement and a distinctive, branching inflorescence. Cleome arborea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to warm, humid climates.
